content: check out the other two patterns in the fall into autumn collection 1 here * sunflower beanie 2 * autumn adventures beanie 3 ***the inspiration*** there is nothing more exciting than the anticipation of autumn feeling the first hints of crispness in the air watching the leaves turn crimson and gold and tasting the warm flavor of a pumpkin spice latte are some of my favorite small joys each year but of course fall wouldn t be complete without headbands ***the construction*** i designed this beautiful lace piece with the aim of making lace knitting simple and easy to understand it s a great first lace project because the yarn is bulky so it works up quickly and you can see what you re doing also it s a small piece so if worst comes to worst it won t hurt too much if you have to rip it out and start over i ve also included a helpful photo tutorial for the tricky stitch to make learning extra easy ***the yarn*** the yarn i used for this pattern is stitch please chunky by premier yarns 4 i used the colorway salted caramel i ve tried so many wool yarns over the years and they re often scratchy and uncomfortable to wear not this one it s 100% wool yet it feels soft and luxurious to the touch and it comes in so many beautiful colors to choose from the best part is that it s extremely affordable to fit any budget give it a try you ll love it one thing to note is that stitch please chunky is on the lighter side of bulky so make sure to not use a heavy bulky yarn as your headband will become too wide however you could substitute a heavier worsted weight ***materials*** * approximately 36 yards 33 m of a bulky weight 5 yarn * us size 10 6mm knitting needles * common notions such as measuring tape yarn needle and scissors ***measurements*** approximately 18 46 cm around and 5 13 cm wide don t worry it s super stretchy ***gauge*** 6 sts x 10 row = 2 in lace pattern ***disclaimer*** you are more than welcome to sell anything you make using this pattern i just ask that you credit me as the designer you may not claim this pattern as your own and you may not sell or distribute its contents in any form if you have any questions you can
